page.title: 19SPECIAL FEATURES
page.content: THE BROOK,FORMERLY KNOWN AS THE GREENHILL,IS BELIEVED TO HAVE BEEN THE SITE OF THE STOCKS WHICH ARE ON RECORD AS BEING REPAIRED IN THE 17th CENTURY. THE PUMP ON THE BROOK IS NOT USED BUT IT IS USABLE.RECENTALY IT HAS BEEN RENOVATED. MOST SHOPS ARE ALONG THE HIGH STREET.ABOUT 24 SHOPS SELL ALL KINDS OF FOODSTUFF,GROCERY, HARD- WARE,DO-IT-YOURSELF MATERIALS.SID BISHOPS BICYCLES REPAIR AND SELL BIKES & D.I.Y. MATERIALS. THERE ARE 7 PUBS IN HISTON & IMPINGTON.THE PRICES OF FOOD IS DIFFERENT IN MANY SHOPS ALTHOUGH THE FOOD IS THE SAME IN ALL THE SHOPS WHICH HAVE DIFFERENT SETTINGS WITH WIDE ROWS BETWEEN THE SHELVES TO WORK DOWN.ONE SHOP CHANGED INTO ESTATE AGENTS AND ANOTHER INTO A VIDEO SHOP,MEMBERSHIP OF WHICH COSTS Â£10.00.THE CO-OP CHEMISTS SERVE THE COMMUNITY.
